programme.desc: It's Not Easy Making Green. The buyers have travelled to Allentown in search of old money. Items up for grabs today include rare Civil War-era objects from Gettysburg. S4, Ep8

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Dino Mite. Vintage advertising pits the buyers against each other in Knoxville, where Sally spends big to win a dinosaur. Meanwhile, Billy's attempt at sabotage backfires. S4, Ep9

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Big Boy Bucks. The buyers take a gamble on vintage casino and advertising items, including a Bob's Big Boy statue in Vegas. Meanwhile, a rare Elvis recording could pay off big time. S4, Ep10

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Gunning for Dollars. A giant Gatling gun and a rare advertising piece from Nabisco Cookies are among the items that interest the buyers at a gambling auction in Las Vegas. S4, Ep11

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: The Wizard of Odd. A lost property auction in reveals an old-school boom box from the 1980s, while a buyer is over the rainbow about a rare 'Wizard of Oz' piece in a sealed trunk. S4, Ep12

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: Safari Sale. The buyers visit South Africa for a once-in-a-lifetime auction, and Billy appraises a ceremonial mask. Will profit still be made outside the specialist's comfort zone? S4, Ep13

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Junkyard And The Bandit. Andy Cohen spots a rusty Trans AM at an auction, and all he can see are dollar signs. But he quickly finds out that most cars are at an auction for a reason. S3, Ep1

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Playing With Fire. Andy is no stranger to risky car builds, but when his shop takes on a scorched Audi S6, it's a gamble - and the deeper he digs, the more problems he finds. S3, Ep2

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Buck Wild Bronco. When Andy bags a 1994 Bronco at auction, he sees potential redneck gold. Just as Andy's monster truck kicks into gear, his dad Bobby throws a wrench in the gears. S3, Ep3

programme.title: Junkyard Empire
programme.desc: Junkyard Genius. Andy is thrilled to find a classic Chevy Blazer on the roadside and win a totalled Porsche Cayman on a bid. But the honeymoon's over when the hard work starts. S3, Ep4

programme.title: Kindig Customs
programme.desc: Dave's New Toy. Dave loves anything VW and finds an awesome deal for a rare Transporter pickup. After modifying it, the real dilemma begins: does he keep it or auction it? S6, Ep10

programme.title: Kindig Customs
programme.desc: Updating A Classic. A beauty of a car from Kindig's past arrives back in the shop for an engine upgrade. Dave and Kevin head to Detroit to see the latest engine building technology. S6, Ep11

programme.title: Kindig Customs
programme.desc: Kevin's Mystery Machine. Kevin works on an after-hours project, using an Escalade body on a Suburban chassis to create a SEMA spectacle. He designs every aspect of the car. S6, Ep12

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage
programme.desc: Low-Buck Speed Project! Tony Angelo and Lucky Costa are building cheap speed. With a modest budget, the guys find a car to work on for the #Bonemaro project! S4, Ep1

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage
programme.desc: Cheap V-8 Turbo Build! Tony Angelo and Lucky Costa take their low-budget drag project, #Bonemaro, upgrade the engine for boost, and build a turbo system! S4, Ep2

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage
programme.desc: 512 Cubic-Inch Stroker Wagon. Tony Angelo and Lucky Costa build an old-fashioned sleeper! They track down a 1965 Plymouth Fury III wagon and revive the old Mopar 400 engine. S4, Ep3

programme.title: Hot Rod Garage
programme.desc: Budget Turbo V-8 Drag Times! Tony Angelo and Lucky Costa are at the race track in California to rev up the 1979 Turbo Camaro project, the #Bonemaro! S4, Ep4

programme.title: Expedition Bigfoot
programme.desc: Fresh Kills. Russell is unnerved by a gruesome discovery while the rest of the team searches for a top-secret research facility hidden beneath the forest. S3, Ep5

programme.title: Expedition Bigfoot
programme.desc: Return To Lake Fear. The team uncovers a potential Bigfoot kill zone and launch a squadron of patrol drones to sweep the area for the existence of Sasquatch. S3, Ep6

programme.title: The Simpsons: Mmmm, Food
programme.desc: El Viaje Misterioso de Nuestro Jomer (The Mysterious Voyage of Our Homer): Homer eats a dangerous chilli, has a hallucinogenic trip and meets a talking coyote (Johnny Cash).

programme.title: The Simpsons: Mmmm, Food
programme.desc: Burger Kings: Mr Burns gets into the plant-based burger business. But Lisa is convinced that he has an ulterior motive.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Mmmm, Food
programme.desc: Super Franchise Me: Marge opens a catering franchise after her sandwiches become a hit at the school. But then another franchise opens right across the street.

programme.title: Moonfall
programme.desc: (2022) Sci-fi disaster with Halle Berry. A NASA bigwig, a disgraced astronaut and a conspiracy theorist are all that stand between the Earth and a plummeting Moon. But are aliens involved?

programme.title: Django Unchained
programme.desc: (2012) Quentin Tarantino's darkly comic, award-laden Western with Jamie Foxx, Christopher Waltz, Leonardo DiCaprio and Samuel L Jackson. A freed slave searches for his wife... and revenge.

programme.title: Fremont
programme.desc: (2023) Wryly amusing character-study drama with Anaita Wali Zada. A lonely Afghan refugee who writes fortunes for cookies decides to send a message to the world. With Jeremy Allen White.

programme.title: The Actors
programme.desc: (2003) Crime comedy caper starring Michael Caine and Dylan Moran. Two actors need to use all their thespian skills to stay alive when they con a retired gangster.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Sound Barrier
programme.desc: (1952) Drama starring Ralph Richardson as a pioneering aviator determined to break the sound barrier, even if it means risking the lives of those closest to him. Directed by David Lean.

programme.title: Against the Wind
programme.desc: (1948) Spy thriller. Robert Beatty, Simone Signoret, Jack Warner and Gordon Jackson star as British-trained saboteurs sent to Second World War Belgium. But one of them is a traitor...

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: (1959) Satirical comedy starring Peter Sellers (in a triple role) and the original Doctor Who, William Hartnell. The world's smallest state, Grand Fenwick, declares war on the USA.

programme.title: The Fallen Idol
programme.desc: (1948) Adaptation of Graham Greene's story with Ralph Richardson and Bobby Henrey. A butler who is accused of murdering his wife, has only a schoolboy to fight his corner.

programme.title: The Personal History of David...
programme.desc: ...Copperfield Interview Special: Director Armando Iannucci and actor Dev Patel, who stars in the title role, talk about bringing Charles Dickens' beloved novel to the screen.

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: (2008) Remake of the sci-fi classic with Keanu Reeves. An alien visits Earth to tell humankind to stop destroying the planet. But when he's attacked, he decides to eradicate us instead...

programme.title: Free Guy
programme.desc: (2021) Comedy action starring Ryan Reynolds. Guy lives in Free City. Free City isn't real. Nor is Guy. It's all a big online game. Can he take down the corrupt game publisher?

programme.title: Overlord
programme.desc: (2018) World War II horror produced by JJ Abrams, with Jovan Adepo. American soldiers parachute into occupied France, where they're confronted by the horrific results of Nazi experiments.

programme.title: Flag Day
programme.desc: (2021) Crime drama based on a true story, directed by and starring Sean Penn as a talented counterfeiter who's not so good as a father. Features Penn's real-life kids Dylan and Hopper Jack.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Hue & Cry
programme.desc: (1947) The very first Ealing comedy is set in the post-war East End. A boy tries to catch a gang of thieves who are using his favourite comic to communicate their dastardly deeds.

programme.title: The Personal History of David...
programme.desc: ...Copperfield Interview Special: Director Armando Iannucci and actor Dev Patel, who stars in the title role, talk about bringing Charles Dickens' beloved novel to the screen.

programme.title: Ferdinand
programme.desc: (2017) Charming animated bovine road movie from the makers of Ice Age. A huge but gentle bull (voiced by John Cena) tries to get home after being sent away to a bull fighting ranch.

programme.title: Babe
programme.desc: (1995) Charming family comedy-drama about a clever little pig who forms a close bond with a farmer and discovers a talent for herding sheep. With James Cromwell.

programme.title: Babe: Pig in the City
programme.desc: (1998) Charming family comedy sequel. The farm's in trouble and only a sheep-herding pig can save the day. But after a customs mix-up, Babe ends up in a boarding house for lost animals...

programme.title: The Electrical Life of Louis...
programme.desc: ...Wain Interview Special: Stars Benedict Cumberbatch and Claire Foy talk about making director Will Sharpe's eccentric biopic of artist and inventor Louis Wain.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels
programme.desc: (2019) Action comedy with Kristen Stewart, Naomi Scott and Ella Balinska. When an engineer blows the whistle on a deadly device, the Angels put their lives on the line to save the planet.

programme.title: The Lost City
programme.desc: (2022) Comedy adventure with Sandra Bullock and Channing Tatum. When a romance novelist is kidnapped wearing a pink jumpsuit, her hapless cover model heads to the jungle to rescue her.

programme.title: The Shape of Water
programme.desc: (2017) Guillermo del Toro's Oscar-winning romantic fantasy stars Sally Hawkins as a mute cleaning lady who develops feelings for a mysterious, aquatic humanoid while working in a lab.

programme.title: Werewolves Within
programme.desc: (2021) Comedy horror with Milana Vayntrub. A park ranger is sent to a town where everyone is at each other's throats, figuratively at first, but then literally. Is a werewolf to blame?

programme.desc: Join Patrick for two hours of spirited debate and news making interviews. Top guests tackle the issues that matter, with a sharp take on every story.

programme.title: Patrick Christys Tonight Late Edition
programme.desc: Tomorrow's news, tonight. All the major stories making the front pages and full coverage of all the breaking news at home and abroad with Patrick Christys.

programme.title: Farage
programme.desc: Nigel Farage doesn't hold back in his GB News prime-time show. Hear his views and give your own in an hour of discussion and debate. Join Nigel as he takes on the big stories other media won't touch.

programme.title: Jacob Rees-Mogg's State Of The Nation Replay
programme.desc: Join Jacob for his unique and unmissable take on the day's news.

programme.desc: Join Stephen Dixon and Ellie Costello to start your day across the United Kingdom. This is your breakfast show. Join the conversation about what is happening in our nation and the world.

programme.title: Britain's Newsroom
programme.desc: Miriam and Alex present every Friday morning. When the news happens, it happens here. But what does it mean for you? GB News brings you the biggest stories and the answers you need from across the UK.

programme.desc: Tackling the big stories from all angles and perspectives. Weekdays from midday, Tom Harwood and Dawn Neesom bring you the most compelling stories from across the United Kingdom.

programme.desc: Join Martin for an up-to-the-minute take on the day's events delivered in his own unique and lively style.

programme.desc: Plain-speaking, straight-talking - Michelle delivers her individual take on the day's news.

programme.desc: Britain was once the envy of the world. Join Matt Goodwin as he explores how we fix the problems facing the country.

programme.desc: Join GB News for a fun and friendly look at the news with debates on the topics that really matter to you.

programme.title: Genius Game
programme.desc: With the first person having been eliminated, only 10 players return for the Main Match of Zombie Game. The contestants who are designated zombies have to turn the ones who are humans into zombies, while their opponent must avoid being turned. programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Garden: Grow Your Own Special
programme.desc: Cameras follow Alan Titchmarsh across the seasons as he transforms his bare backyard into a stunning kitchen garden, filled with over 60 varieties of delicious produce. Joining Alan in his grow your own challenge is Kate Garraway, creating her first health and well-being garden to suit the changing needs of her family, and Love Your Garden presenter Frances Tophill will attempt to create a stunning kitchen garden just metres from the Devon coast. After months of hard work and obstacles faced, their finished gardens are revealed

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

programme.title: EFL Live
programme.desc: Southampton v Portsmouth (Kick-off 12.00pm). Hugh Woozencroft presents coverage of the Championship match between the local rivals at St Mary's Stadium. The last meeting between the teams came in the 2019/20 EFL Cup, when Southampton recorded a comfortable 4-0 win at Fratton Park. However, a closer fought encounter is anticipated this time around now the sides are in the same division for the first time since the 2011/12 season. With commentary by Sam Matterface and Iain Dowie, analysis from Matt Taylor and Francis Benali, and reports by Aaron Paul

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Doncaster

programme.title: Jack Reacher
programme.desc: Action crime thriller starring Tom Cruise. When five innocent people are gunned down in Pittsburgh, all evidence points to former US Army sniper James Barr. Despite being no friend of Barr's, Reacher looks into the murders and discovers the victims may not have been so randomly selected after all.

programme.title: EFL Live
programme.desc: Southampton v Portsmouth (Kick-off 12.00pm). Hugh Woozencroft presents coverage of the Championship match between the local rivals at St Mary's Stadium. The last meeting between the teams came in the 2019/20 EFL Cup, when Southampton recorded a comfortable 4-0 win at Fratton Park. However, a closer fought encounter is anticipated this time around now the sides are in the same division for the first time since the 2011/12 season. Despite being no friend of Barr's, Reacher looks into the murders and discovers the victims may not have been so randomly selected after all.

programme.title: Genius Game
programme.desc: With the first person having been eliminated, only 10 players return for the Main Match of Zombie Game.
